description: From Middle English depryven, from Old French depriver, from Medieval Latin dēprīvō, from Latin dē- + prīvō. Displaced native Old English berēafian.

verbs.description: deprive (third-person singular simple present deprives, present participle depriving, simple past and past participle deprived)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To take something away from (someone) and keep it away; to deny someone something.
examples: If we had been deprived of it, the most serious consequence would be that we'd be deprived of philosophy.
